meanings.definition: To communicate or indicate by a signal.
meanings.sent1: She signaled her friend to come over with a wave.
meanings.sent2: The traffic light signaled for the cars to stop.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel signaled to the other animals that the coast was clear.
meanings.sent4: The distant lighthouse signaled safety to the sailors lost at sea.
meanings.sent5: The smoke from the chimney signaled that someone was home.

meanings.sent1: He signaled for help by waving his arms frantically.
meanings.sent2: The referee signaled a touchdown with his hands in the air.
meanings.sent3: The cat signaled its hunger by meowing loudly at the kitchen door.
meanings.sent4: The stars in the night sky signaled the beginning of a new season.
meanings.sent5: The teacher signaled the end of the test by clapping her hands.

meanings.definition: To attract attention or make something known.
meanings.sent1: The bright neon sign signaled the entrance to the store.
meanings.sent2: The sudden silence in the room signaled that something was wrong.
meanings.sent3: The loud crash signaled the start of the surprise party.
meanings.sent4: The smell of fresh cookies signaled a warm welcome to the guests.
meanings.sent5: The sound of thunder signaled an approaching storm.
